pullRequest.title: Range request explicit column selection
pullRequest.bodyText:
Goals (and why):
Fixes - Reference Issue
In order to automatically use Nathan's optimization on single-column table range scans, the generated code explicitly specifies the set of columns in "all columns" range scan request.
Implementation Description (bullets):

When columns are not specified in range request, update the range request to explicitly retain all columns.
No effect on dynamic column tables

Testing (What was existing testing like?  What have you done to improve it?):

Existing tests suffice for correctness

Concerns (what feedback would you like?):

Does this actually improve perf?

Where should we start reviewing?:
TableRenderer.ClassRenderer#renderGetRange
TableRenderer.ClassRenderer#renderGetRanges
TableRenderer.ClassRenderer#renderGetAllRowsUnordered
Priority (whenever / two weeks / yesterday):
By the end of next week.

commit.message: Include all columns in rangeRequest explicitly when columnSelection is empty.
Augment columnSelection for getAllRowsUnordered | range scan is turned off

nodes.bodyText:
generally, prefer having the method name tell you what it does. Augment just means 'change', pretty much - maybe something like optimizeColumnSelections and optimizeColumnSelection.
Also, instead of streaming it and collecting back into a new collection, I might be minded to just write return Iterables.transform(ranges, this::optimizeColumnSelection).
I think we still want this to be named optimizeRangeRequest? A ColumnSelection is a different thing (which I see you've added renderer code for later on).
nit: I'm pretty sure Collectors and StreamSupport aren't used any more.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1294,5 +1323,9 @@ private static boolean isDynamic(TableMetadata table) {
         ColumnRangeSelections.class,
         ColumnRangeSelection.class,
         Iterators.class,
+        ArrayList.class,
+        Collectors.class,
+        StreamSupport.class

nodes.bodyText: If changing the above, this should also be changed.

I think it's easier to say what the change does (as opposed to going into detail as to how we do it). So improvement is correct, but I'd write this more as something like:

AtlasDB generated code now optimises getRanges and getRangesLazy to select only required columns. This is known to improve performance for single-column tables (Nathan's optimization). This does not affect dynamic column tables.

Also, I'd add at the end, for our non-metallic friends,

AtlasDB users that check in their schemas need to regenerate them to benefit from this improvement.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+type: improvement
+improvement:
+  description: "In order to automatically use Nathan's optimization on single-column
+    table range scans, the generated code explicitly specifies the set of columns
+    in \"all columns\" range scan request. \n\nThis does not affect dynamic column
+    tables.\n"
